description:
Akuma-kun is a boy who was adopted and risen by the former Akuma: Shingo Umoregi. He works as a paranormal investigator and solves murder mysteries with the helping hand of his half-human partner Mephisto the Third.

The show, despite being an alternate story, is set to be the adventure of Shingo's "son", therefore, it could be considered as a sequel to the 1989 original

(Source: Netflix)

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

node.description:
A Japanese mangaka, illustrator and a leading researcher in youkai painting and youkai research. Although born in Osaka, he was raised in Sakaiminato City, Tottori Prefecture. In 1943, during World War II, he joined army as a soldier under New Guinea Front - Rabaul. After many harsh war experiences, he lost his left arm in an attack by the US. 

He debuted in 1958 with his work "Rocketman." From 1960, he started releasing one of his most famous works "GeGeGe no Kitaro" series. For a while he worked for rental magazines, until 1964, when he debuted for his first commercial magazine, i.e, Garo. As a youkai researcher, he has served as president of the World Youkai Association , a member of the Japanese Folklore Society, and a member of the Council of the Folk Art Society.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/01_chan)

He graduated from Yoyogi Animation school and joined Studio Junio afterwards. After leaving Studio Junio, he became a freelancer and often works with Studio Sunrise and GONZO.
In 2008, him and former GONZO producer Ikeda Touyo founded Encourage Films Co., Ltd, with a capital of 5 million yen.
Ikeda Touyo would serve as the representative director and president of Encourage Films. 
With the death of Ikeda Touyo, on February 17, 2013, he was appointed as the representative director and CEO of Encourage Films.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satojumichi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤順一)

Junichi Satou is a Japanese anime director, best known for working on shoujo-based anime and in the magical girl genre. He was formerly associated with [TYO Animations](https://anilist.co/studio/333/), formerly known as [Hal Film Maker](https://anilist.co/studio/34/).

Satou’s first major work was directing the first, and a portion of the second season of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/), after which he handed the position over to [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/), although he continued to storyboard and direct episodes for the later seasons. Satou later went on to co-direct [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) alongside [Takuya Igarashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105087/), as well as the critically acclaimed [Princess Tutu](https://anilist.co/anime/721/). Satou served as chief director for long-runner [Sgt. Frog](https://anilist.co/anime/516/), and in recent years has become more known for his iyashikei works such as [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/) and [Tamayura](https://anilist.co/anime/9055/).

He's married to [Yasuno Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/144094/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lvdctv) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lvdctv/) | [Website](https://lovedesign.jp/)

Graphic designer specializing in various design works.

Voice actress and dubbing director at Iyuno Poland and VSI Warsaw.

Daughter of [Paweł Galia](https://anilist.co/staff/307444/) and [Ewa Serwa](https://anilist.co/staff/261560).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/henriquecanales/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/henriquecanales) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/henrique.canales) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/Canponto7) | [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1309545)

Henrique Canales is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Viego (League of Legends)
- Karl Heisenberg (Resident Evil Village)
- Achi (Victor and Valentino)
- Tomas Vrbada / Smoke (Mortal Kombat 1)
- Jonas McClellan (Hailey Dean Mystery)
- Kayce Dutton (Yellowstone)
- Thermite (Rainbow Six Siege)
- Merlin, Living Totem and Red Skull (LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2)
- Mateo Canalejos (Money Heist)
- Robert Minoru (Marvel's Runaways)
- Kang Seung-Wan (Sweet Home)
- Mariano Urquiza (Bia)
- Teo Álvarez (Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales)
- Armand Roulin (Loving Vincent)
- Oscar Gaitán (1st dub; Un Refugio para el Amor)
- Makani (Marvel's Inhumans)
- Diao (Wish Dragon)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

In 2008, him and former GONZO producer Ikeda Touyo founded Encourage Films Co., Ltd, with a capital of 5 million yen.
Ikeda Touyo would serve as the representative director and president of Encourage Films.
